language__wordnet_type__gloss: (a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds or conventional symbols; "he taught foreign languages"; "the language introduced is standard throughout the text"; "the speed with which a program can be executed depends on the language in which it is written")
language__caption: Knowledge of the Polish language within parts of Europe. Polish is not a majority language anywhere outside of Poland, though Polish minority groups are present in some neighboring countries.

Geographical distribution of the Polish language  and other Central and Eastern European languages and dialects. A large Polish-speaking diaspora remains in the countries located east of Poland that were once the Eastern Borderlands of the Second Polish Republic .

The "Recovered Territories"  were parts of Germany, including the Free City of Danzig , that became part of Poland after World War II. The territory shown in grey was lost to the Soviet Union, which expelled many Poles from the area.
language__hypernym__caption: Real time MRI scan of a person speaking in Mandarin Chinese
Spectrogram of American English vowels  showing the formants f1 and f2
Cuneiform is the first known form of written language, but spoken language predates writing by at least many tens of thousands of years.
Humans have speculated about the origins of language throughout history. The Biblical myth of the Tower of Babel is one such account; other cultures have different stories of how language arose.
Children of deaf adults using American Sign Language
The Tower of Babel by Pieter Bruegel the Elder. Oil on board, 1563.
The syllable "wi" in the Hangul script

A spectrogram showing the sound of the spoken English word "man", which is written phonetically as . Note that in flowing speech, there is no clear division between segments, only a smooth transition as the vocal apparatus moves.
A mural in Teotihuacan, Mexico  depicting a person emitting a speech scroll from his mouth, symbolizing speech
The sign for "wi" in Korean Sign Language

language__states__caption: St. Mary's Basilica on the Main Market Square in Kraków is an example of Brick Gothic architecture.
The 16th-century City Hall of Poznań illustrates the Renaissance style.
Fryderyk Chopin was a renowned classical composer and virtuoso pianist.
Tadeusz Kościuszko was a veteran and hero of both the Polish and American wars of independence.
Joseph Conrad, author of popular books such as Heart of Darkness  and Nostromo .
Adam Mickiewicz, whose national epic poem Pan Tadeusz  is considered a masterpiece of Polish literature.
Artur Rubinstein was one of the greatest concert pianists of the 20th century.
